title: Specsavers type
content:
This is used in their promotional material... interestingly, it is very similar in style to their logotype... which is an odd choice I would have thought...

Anyway, here's the type...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018105811im_/http:/typophile.com/files/case_006_3945.jpg)

At first I thought Klavika, but it's clearly not that!

Steve
author: buddhaboy

comments.content: [WTF](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018105811/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/Option3?imageid=10088335&id=0000053248cf9751000ef79300001c0d&glyphcount=10&wtfserver=&md5=4dee0c369f32432975ee277f684a3885) says it's [Amplitude Medium](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018105811/http:/www.google.si/search?q=font++%09+Amplitude+Medium), although inktrap in **v** is removed…
Could be something custom from Christian like [Amplitude Headline](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018105811/http:/christianschwartz.com/amphead.shtml).

It's "amplitude specsavers" - looks like they had their own custom version made.  
AmplitudeSpecsavers-Demi  
AmplitudeSpecsavers-Book
